Reviews.Title: Refurbished and does not work at all
Reviews.Author: caraqueña
Reviews.Content: When I first got my phone, it seemed to work perfectly with my carrier in Venezuela (Movilnet) even thought it had a problem with the WiFi connection. I used the phone for a whole week knowing that "Cell Lounge" sent me a refurbished blackberry when I specifically ordered a NEW one; anyway it stopped working because it presented a "JVM error 102" and it wouldn't go on. The screen just stayed black with those words on it. That same day, I found out that the USB did not work either. I regret this purchase.Cuando recibi el telefono, parecia funcionar perfectamente con mi linea venezolana, Movilnet, aunque tenia problemas al conectarme con el WiFi. Utilice el telefono por una semana sabiendo que la compania "Cell Lounge" me habia enviado un blackberry reconstruido cuando yo especificamente ordene uno NUEVO. De todas formas, el BB dejo de funcionar y la pantalla solo decia "JVM error 102", y no prendia el telefono. La pantalla quedo en blanco. Ese mismo dia, descubri que el puerto USB tampoco funcionaba. Estoy muy arrepentida de esta compra.

Reviews.Title: I paid for a new BB Bold phone and I received an used one
Reviews.Author: Jose Prado
Reviews.Content: On December 19, 2011, I placed the Order Number: 102-4853384-6382659 to buy a New Blackberry 9700 Bold Unlocked Quad-Band 3G Smartphone with 3.2 MP Camera, GPS, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth--International Version with Warranty (Black). Price: $233.99. In Stock. Ships from and sold by OneGreatSeller. I received it on January 2012 and I keep it until my wife's anniversary on April 2012. In our anniversary, I gave my wife a New Blackberry 9700 Bold bought Via Amazom by OneGreatSeller. What a surprise? The portable phone was used (old). Its memory card has more than 170 photographs, among them some pornographics and strippers pictures . I am very angry about that. It is a fraud.Jose R. Prado daviro_17@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: "SellPhoneStop" and Blackberry thieves thieves
Reviews.Author: Jesus Barrios "jabarriosb"
Reviews.Content: "SellPhoneStop" unos ladrones. No les compren. Me envio un equipo que solo funciona para digitel (900 MHz) cuando ofrece en el aviso uno que funciona para Digitel, Movilnet y Movistar. Pase dias buscando en Amazon.com un equipo que funcionara en todas las bandas y estos ladrones lo ofrecen aun a sabiendas que no lo tienen. Espero que Amazon tome cartas en el asunto con estos pillos. Incluso responden groseramente a los correos. Estaba tan contento con el aparato que los califique positivamente aun cuando el equipo que llegó es visiblemente viejo. Los plasticos estan rayados y no trae las conexiones electricas para Europa y China, propias de Blackberry (he comprado varios equipos). Se congela, no carga la batería, no prende, no apaga, terrible."SellPhoneStop" thieves. Do not buy. I sent a team that only works for Digitel (900 MHz) when offered in an ad that works for Digitel, Movilnet and Movistar. Spend a day looking at Amazon.com team that worked on all bands and offer these thieves even knowing that they do not. I hope Amazon take action on the matter with these crooks. Even grossly respond to emails. I was so happy with the unit being considered as positive even when the team arrived is visibly older. The plastics are scratched and does not bring electrical connections to Europe and China, own Blackberry (I have bought several computers). Freezes, not charging, does not work, turn off, terrible.

Reviews.Author: windiciti
Reviews.Content: My old Blackberry Curve stopped working. I tried both the Blackberry Q10 and the Samsung 4, but I did not have the right touch for either.I was happy to find  a brand new Blackberry 9700 World Phone at under $100, unlocked  with warranty from Mango Wireless, but later became scared when I read horror stories about companies shipping reconditioned phones sold as new, old batteries, etc. and some that did not work at all in various parts of South America to which I travel.The phone arrived exactly as promised, in 2 or 3 days, in a new sealed Blackberry box, with a charger and battery. I put in my old SIM card and was almost ready to go!I received quite a bit of tech support from T-Mobile to set up my e-mail, etc. because I am not handy.Very satisfied with the product and Mango Wireless which sold it to me.

Reviews.Title: Paid for "NEW" but received a "USED"
Reviews.Author: KEN KLENKE
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone from the Amazon Fulfilled carrier/ seller.  I made absolute sure that I clicked on the "new" option.What I received -1. Phone came in Blackberry packaging, nothing generic, not even the battery.  Everything was new....2. The phone itself has been used. There is dust in every crevice of the keys and buttons.  The charger "hole" has been tampered with, as if it has been plugged into a charger multiple times; there are scratches around this area.  The very top right button on the phone that is used to silence it, does not work at all.  The trackpad was very, very scratched and oddly sticky.  It's obvious that this phone did not come to me as being brand new.  When I turned the phone on, AT&T;'s logo flashed onto the screen.  My T-Mobile SIM card WORKED with this phone, however, I have returned it.If you are lucky enough to actually receive a NEW Blackberry (since you paid for one) then enjoy it, I know it is a great phone.  I found that some sellers are unreliable and it's unfortunate that I did not receive what I had paid for.

REALLY I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THIS STORE BECAUSE IT WAS THOUGHT RELIABLE AND SENT ME A PHONE THAT DOES NOT WORK! Friends, keep in mind that before making a purchase, we need to see the reviews and the reputation of sellers to see if it is reliable or not, and to avoid the inconventiente I'm running right now with this store.! Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good, reliable and new phone; YOU ARE LOOKING AT THE WRONG PLACE !I buy phones to resell. When i bought this phone i bought it with the intention that it was NEW when it was actually REFURBISHED !The phone has MULTIPLE ERRORS ! Firstly the volume button stopped working. Then the whole PHONE STOPPED WORKING ! When it turned on there was a white screen with a battery with a red line across it showing. When I took it to the technician it is realized that it was refurbished as there were replacement screws in them and NOT THE ORIGINAL. This problem forced me into changing the circuit board which was VERY EXPENSIVE !AS SUCH I ADVISE YOU ALL NOT TO BUY THIS PHONE !

It was kinda suspicious that is new jugging by the packaging and some scratches on the battery but all together for someone with my vision wasn't looking bad. Reviews.Title: Now obsolete
Reviews.Author: bcaulf
Reviews.Content: This was a good phone in its time but it is not able to run the current BlackBerry OS 7. Since it has 256M of RAM and OS 7 requires a minimum of 512M to run, there will never be a release for this phone. OS 7 is a big advance particularly in terms of the browser. On the 9700, often it is impossible to load a page because there is not enough memory free even with no other app running and only one tab open. The 9320 Curve has 512M and the 9860 Torch and 9900 Bold have 768M, solving this problem. They also have a faster graphics chip that is needed for the new OS version. And the new platform requires a touch screen and accelerometer, not present here.The processor is old and you'll spend quite a bit of time watching its delay clock spin.Also, this phone is 3G only and 4G networks have been widely deployed. Many newer BlackBerries are 4G compatible and have 4x the maximum download speed.

Reviews.Title: processor very slow, limited apps, not much of a future for BB
Reviews.Author: Fred Keezer
Reviews.Content: I work for a wireless carrier, I have used this for two years now, here are some of the pro's and cons...pros: 1. email is good, if you are on the BES, and also configurable for internet email like aol, etc...2. I like the functionality of keeping notes that upload to my company email note file on outlook, instantly. 3. keypad is nice and seems to be pretty durable even after two years of button mashing.4, voice quality is the best i have yet to run accross for a blackberry. I have used them since the beginning and this one outperforms the rest.Cons: takes forever to reset, limited apps, many websites and services are discontinuing apps for blackberry in favor of Droid platform or Iphone...Also has issues with youtube video formats, my carrier still has not been able to provide fixes for this, so if you youtube alot, dont expect to do it with the Blackberry. Some fixes work for some but not all. That is a problem.

However when I saw that OEM Planet was selling the product I decided to buy from them as I had great service from them in the past. The phone came very fast, it was brand new in the original blackberry box. It came with all the accessories brand new from the package. The phone was unlocked, I just inserted my sim card and it instantly connected to my local network. I will encourage everyone to purchase from OEM Planet as other sellers got bad reviews. Excellent product and service. I love my new Bold 9700!

Reviews.Title: BB9700 Bold / seller misrepresents...
Reviews.Author: nekoree "nekoree"
Reviews.Content: the BB9700 is Xcellent, short battery life but otherwise full of rich features - Cell Lounge Inc (aka Unlocked Blackberry Store) Customer Service responds quickly but is ineffectual because CS does not set policy.after 5 weeks of e-mails to the seller and Amazon, and 2 "follow-up" shipments to replace missing items, I am still without a carrying case and CD kit for the BB9700 as listed on the box. The seller insists the items listed on the box do not come with the phone and have made "an exception" to replace the items I mentioned.Now why would the items not be included with the phone as the outer T-Mobile box lists everything that is standard with this item, the BB9700 Bold?#1) the phone advertised is onyx (black) but my T-Mobile box shows an all-chrome outer shell  #2) the battery included with the BB9700 was a generic battery, not an OEM Blackberry battery - has since been replaced with an OEM Blackberry battery  #3) the stereo headset was missing but has since been replaced but again, with a generic, imported item and not and OEM Blackberry item.I did agree to "settle" and forgo the carrying case and CD kit just to put this behind me.in my case, on more than one occasion for this order (see above), this seller replaced OEM products with inferior import items and omitted standard items altogether.I have purchased many, many, many phones from T-Mobile over the last 15 years and never, ever have they ever had import-items such as batteries, headsets, chargers in their boxes with any of their phones.  Nor have they omitted nor removed essential tips, guides, CD programming kits - the contents have always matched their listing on the outer box(es).this seller sends a tracking number to "confirm" shipments and mentions your order has been shipped but the shipments are not actually sent until 2-3 days later.unless you're willing to go through a lot of frustrating correspondence and waiting, I DO NOT recommend this seller.caveat emptor! buyer beware!CHECK buyer feedback BEFORE buying- being on Amazon's website is not an automatic indication of seller reliability nor dependability.

I purchased this from Beast Deals and I certainly have no regrets... even got it updated with OS 6... brand new as described... with a fully functional battery.. comes with headphones, charger, battery, usb cable and user manual... and it is unbranded and unlocked... will work with any GSM network... works with my local network fine... will upload some images shortly... undoubtedly an excellent product by RIM
